helicopterbattle

Class Animation

  • java.lang.Object
    • helicopterbattle.Animation

  • public class Animation
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for animations, e.g. explosion.

    • Field Summary

      State of animation.
      int x
      x and y coordinates.

    • Field Detail

      • x

        public int x
        x and y coordinates. Where to draw the animation on the screen?

      • y

        public int y

      • active

        public boolean active
        State of animation. Is it still active or is it finished? We need this so that we can check and delete animation when is it finished.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Animation

        public Animation(java.awt.image.BufferedImage animImage,
         int frameWidth,
         int frameHeight,
         int numberOfFrames,
         long frameTime,
         boolean loop,
         int x,
         int y,
         long showDelay)
        Creates animation.
        Parameters:
        animImage - Image of animation.
        frameWidth - Width of the frame in animation image "animImage".
        frameHeight - Height of the frame in animation image "animImage" - height of the animation image "animImage".
        numberOfFrames - Number of frames in the animation image.
        frameTime - Amount of time that each frame will be shown before moving to the next one in milliseconds.
        loop - Should animation repeat in loop?
        x - x coordinate. Where to draw the animation on the screen?
        y - y coordinate. Where to draw the animation on the screen?
        showDelay - In milliseconds. How long to wait before starting the animation and displaying it?

    • Method Detail

      • changeCoordinates

        public void changeCoordinates(int x,
                     int y)
        Changes the coordinates of the animation.
        Parameters:
        x - x coordinate. Where to draw the animation on the screen?
        y - y coordinate. Where to draw the animation on the screen?

        Draws current frame of the animation.
        Parameters:
        g2d - Graphics2D
